com.stickycoding.Rokon
Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  com.stickycoding.Rokon.DynamicObject
      com.stickycoding.Rokon.Sprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
TrackingSprite
public class Sprite
extends DynamicObject

Sprite handles both visual and physical parts of in game objects. Basic dynamics can be applied.

Author:
Richard

isDead

public boolean isDead()
Returns:
TRUE if the Sprite is marked for removal from the Layer after the next frame.

markForRemoval

public void markForRemoval()
Marks the Sprite for removal, it will be taken off the Layer at the end of the current frame

public void setVisible(boolean visible)
Parameters:
visible - TRUE if the Sprite is to be drawn on the Layer, default is TRUE

Returns:

the current Texture tile index that is being used by the Sprite

setColor

public void setColor(float red,
                     float green,
                     float blue,
                     float alpha)
Sets the color of the Sprite, this is still applied when a textured. 1,1,1,1 is white and 0,0,0,1 is black

Parameters:
red - 0.0 to 1.0
green - 0.0 to 1.0
blue - 0.0 to 1.0
alpha - 0.0 to 1.0

setCollisionHandler

public void setCollisionHandler(CollisionHandler collisionHandler)
Parameters:
collisionHandler - defines a CollisionHandler which the Sprite should trigger if it collides with any of the registered targets

resetCollisionHandler

public void resetCollisionHandler()
Removes the CollisionHandler, and no longer checks for collisions

addCollisionSprite

public void addCollisionSprite(Sprite target)
Parameters:
target - adds a target Sprite for the CollisionHandler to check for each frame

public void removeCollisionSprite(Sprite target)
Parameters:
target - removes a target from the Sprite's list

setAnimationHandler

public void setAnimationHandler(AnimationHandler animationHandler)
Parameters:
animationHandler - sets an AnimationHandler, which can keep track of animation loops and ends

resetAnimationHandler

public void resetAnimationHandler()
Removes the AnimationHandler from the Sprite

animate

public void animate(int startTile,
                    int endTile,
                    float time)
Animates a Sprite by using tiles from its Texture. This will loop indefinately.

Parameters:
startTile - the first tile index in the animation
endTile - the final tile index used in the animation
time - the time in milliseconds between each frame

animate

public void animate(int startTile,
                    int endTile,
                    float time,
                    int loops,
                    boolean returnToStart)
Animates a Sprite by using tiles from its Texture

Parameters:
startTile - the first tile index in the animation
endTile - the final tile index used in the animation
time - the time in milliseconds between each frame
loops - the number of loops to go through the animation
returnToStart - TRUE if the Sprite should return to startTile when complete, FALSE if the Sprite should stay at endTile when complete

animateRandom

public void animateRandom(int startTile,
                          int endTile,
                          float time)

animateCustom

public void animateCustom(int[] tileCustom,
                          float time)
Animates a Sprite by using custom tiles from its Texture. This will loop indefinately.

Parameters:
tileCustom - is an array containing the tiles indexes of the animation
time - the time in milliseconds between each frame

animateCustom

public void animateCustom(int[] tileCustom,
                          float time,
                          int loops,
                          boolean returnToStart)
Animates a Sprite by using custom tiles from its Texture

Parameters:
tileCustom - is an array containing the tiles indexes of the animation
time - the time in milliseconds between each frame
loops - the number of loops to go through the animation
returnToStart - TRUE if the Sprite should return to startTile when complete, FALSE if the Sprite should stay at endTile when complete

stopAnimation

public void stopAnimation()
Stops the animation, and leaving the Sprite at its current frame

public boolean isAnimating()
Returns:
TRUE if the Sprite is being animated

reset

public void reset(boolean resetTexture)
Resets the sprite to the initial conditions

Parameters:
resetTexture - TRUE if the texture is to be reset to the first tile
